messages.title: A Record of Action for West Suffolk

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A track record of saving a school bus route and securing green transport scheme to a local science park.
Building a stronger economy in the countryside with developing the retail precinct.
The 'triple-lock' has meant that pensioners keep their relative value.

mentions.candidate: Elfreda Tealby-Watson wants every child to have the best start in life.
mentions.tacticalSituation: 2010 General Election result in West Suffolk shows a tactical voting consideration with the Liberal Democrats having 23% against the Conservatives' 50%.

issues.economy: Building a stronger economy in the countryside with developing the retail precinct.
issues.education: A track record of saving a school bus route and securing green transport scheme to a local science park.
issues.socialWelfare: The 'triple-lock' has meant that pensioners keep their relative value.

leaflet.personalStatement: As someone who lives in the area, and whose family came from Exning, I am very familiar with West Suffolk. Outside politics my personal experience as a working mum and lately carer for my own mother gives me an everyday understanding of the practical challenges families face. I will listen and I will act to help constituents with the concerns they bring me.

politicalExperience.achievements: Saving a school bus route and securing a green transport scheme to a local science park. Previous business life and council duties in local development issues.

quotes.text: Elfreda wants every child to have the best start in life.

images.caption: Elfreda Tealby-Watson working with the local Lib Dem Team
Graph showing 2010 General Election result in West Suffolk

leaflet.additionalNotes: Printed by Prontaprint, 129 Upper Chase, Chelmsford CM2 0BN. Published and promoted by Tim Huggan on behalf of Elfreda Tealby-Watson (Liberal Democrats) both at High Street, Lavenham, nr Bury St Edmunds, IP28 6AA.
